title: Chapter 2573: Entering The Trap, Not Losing The Entire Game (3)
body:
Chapter 2573: Entering The Trap, Not Losing The Entire Game (3)

Chapter 2573: Entering the Trap, Not Losing the Entire Game (3)

Editor: Nyoi-Bo Studio

Changde Town.

The ruins of Cao’s Blacksmith Shop.

“Hoo”

A faint sound reverberated, and smoke rose over the small town.

The residual spiritual senses of Jin Ren within the Divine Puppet felt penetrated by something.

The intangible ripple-like energy swept through the entire Changde Town.

In the next moment, he realized that the group of Cutting Path Stage and Higher Void white-clothed people lurking several streets away all collapsed like soft-footed shrimps, their eyes rolling back as they fell to the ground.

“What power is this?”

The Divine Puppet could no longer clearly perceive the situation, and Jin Ren couldn’t discern the source of this power.

He still hadn’t seen Kui Leihan make any move!

Perhaps, this was a special application of Penetrating Divine Senses?

But…

A mere glance…

Or rather, not even a glance and the Higher Void fell?

Suppressing his shock, Jin Ren manipulated the Divine Puppet with all his might, extracting a spirit gem from Zhu Yike’s spatial ring within the abdominal cavity…

He then inserted it into the energy activation core within the Divine Puppet’s buttocks.

“Hum…”

“Buzz, buzz, buzz.”

A buzzing sound filled the air.

Voices in his mind attempted to emerge but failed.

Unfortunately, all the functions of the Divine Puppet had been rendered useless.

Jin Ren could no longer activate various great arrays, nor could he utilize his weaving ability. The only thing he could control was the physical combat strength of the Divine Puppet itself.

Such as lifting its feet, taking a step…

Kui Leihan had knocked down everyone, leaving only a strand of remnant thought within the Divine Puppet untouched.

When the entire town returned to silence, he spoke, “Do you know why only you were left?”

Jin Ren did not respond, only laboriously taking steps toward Kui Leihan.

Blue-purple electric currents still lingered around Kui Leihan.

Wouldn’t the Divine Puppet be smashed into pieces by barging in like this?

But this didn’t deter Jin Ren’s steps. He knew his spiritual senses were doomed, but like Elder Dao the Flamboyant, he wanted to make a big move.

Kui Leihan remained silent, watching as the Divine Puppet approached. He deliberately retracted the leaked power of the God Punishment Tribulation, the blue-purple electric currents.

“Tap, tap, tap…”

The heavy and firm footsteps echoed through the town.

With each step, some parts fell off, making clanging sounds as they hit the ground.

Until the Divine Puppet reached the giant’s knees, Jin Ren once again felt the meaning of “enormous.”

Setting aside the void attendants of Abyss Island, Kui Leihan was the largest humanoid form Jin Ren had ever seen.

No one else could compare!

The Divine was not even a third of his size!

He really seemed more like an ancient warrior than any other!

This inevitably made one doubt whether Kui Leihan’s race was truly human.

“What do you want?”

Kui Leihan asked as the Divine Puppet remained silent. He tilted his head and peered down at this half-destroyed figure.

Seeing the Divine Puppet bend its knee and leap…

“Clang.”

The spirit gem in its buttocks wasn’t firmly held, and in this considerable movement, it slipped out, like an excretion.

The Divine Puppet successfully leaped onto Kui Leihan’s thigh.

But Jin Ren’s consciousness became even more blurred as if the connection between his main body and spiritual senses were about to be severed.

Kui Leihan’s eyes showed a hint of interest.

This little guy had the greatest courage he had ever seen, daring to jump onto him.

Then, this half-Divine Puppet lifted its arm…

“Clang!”

The arm fell off.

Undeterred, it opened another hole from the shoulder, extending a soft, octopus-like tentacle.

But there were no “eight” tentacles, and the sole tentacle was also severely damaged, evidently the limit of the Divine Puppet’s ability to change its form—this wasn’t even the Weaving Technique, but a physical form transformation.

The octopus tentacle grabbed the arm of the Divine Puppet that had fallen to the ground and slowly raised it.

Just high enough to reach Kui Leihan’s chest.

“Heh.”

Kui Leihan chuckled, still perplexed.

What was this supposed to mean?

Did this arm contain a secret message from Bazhun’an?

All of a sudden, this half-Divine Puppet jumped!

The octopus tentacle, holding its broken arm, slammed it onto Kui Leihan’s head!

“Duang”

For a moment, Kui Leihan was dumbfounded.

After landing, the Divine Puppet collapsed into a pile of debris, the sizzling sound of electricity still echoing, followed by a burst.

Finally, the array wheel head of the Divine Puppet flashed with light, emitting a mocking voice:

“You’d actually grovel at Elder Dao the Flamboyant’s feet?”

“Worthless dog.”
